title: ContextSuite Semantic Event
description: Schema for a ContextSuite Semantic Event. SQL is the primary source of truth.

entity_gid.description: The entity that the event is associated with (Context Suite Specific) (Account or any sub-entity).

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the event, always stored in UTC

type.description: The event type (e.g. "track, page, identify, group, alias, screen etc.")

event.description: The event name (e.g. "Product Added") always capitalized and always ended with a verb in passed tense

anonymous_id.description: The anonymous ID of the user before they are identified.

anonymous_gid.description: The anonymous GID (UUID) of the user before they are identified.

user_id.description: The user ID of the user.

user_gid.description: The user GID (UUID) of the user.

account_id.description: The account ID of the user (Often the same as the entity_gid).

previous_id.description: The user ID of the user before the event (e.g. 'anonymousId' before 'identify').

session_id.description: The session ID of the user in the client that generated the event.

session_gid.description: The session GID (UUID) of the user session that generated the event.

context_ip.description: The IP address of the user in IPv4 format.

customer_facing.description: Indicates if the event is customer-facing (e.g., for UI display). Typically 0 for false, 1 for true. Default is 0.

content.description: A dictionary of additional content associated with the event. Keys can be 'Body', 'Subject', 'Title', 'Description', 'Summary', 'Initial Response', 'Other', etc.

involves.description: Entities involved in the event. Involvement can be implicit (via other properties) or explicit using this structure. Defined in 'involved_schema.json'.

classification.description: Classification of the event (Intent, Categories, etc.)

entity_linking.description: Entity links from content to named entities

contextual_awareness.description: Additional context for entities involved in the event

properties.description: A dictionary of additional properties for the event. Properties may be moved into dedicated columns if possible; otherwise, they are stored here.

analysis.description: Cost analysis of the event. This is strictly for internal use and should not be used for any other purpose. Defined in 'analysis_schema.json'.

base_events.description: Base event information if this is a derived event

access.description: Access control list for the event

local_time.description: The original timestamp of the event in the local timezone of the sender.

original_timestamp.description: The original timestamp of when the event occurred, as reported by the source.

received_at.description: The timestamp when the event was received by the collection system (e.g., Segment).

sent_at.description: The timestamp when the event was sent by the client library.

message_id.description: A unique ID for each message, typically assigned by the client library.

event_gid.description: A unique GID (UUID) for each message, calculated on the server side from the message_id or other factors if missing.

root_event_gid.description: The root event GID (UUID) of the event. If this is a derived (higher order) event, this field will be populated with the GID of the original root event.

analyse.description: Custom analysis flags that override the default analysis behavior for this event.

integrations.description: Custom integration flags that override the default integration behavior for this event.

write_key.description: The write key used to send the event (e.g., a salted hash of the actual write key). Internal field, not user-settable via API.

ttl_days.description: The number of days the event will be stored in the database. Defaults to forever if null.

partition.description: The version of the event message. Internal field used for partitioning, not user-settable via API.
